revised_title: Measurement of Ionization Cross-Section of Neon
tldr: The authors used the crossed-beam method to measure the ionization cross-section of neon in a reaction. The cross-section increased linearly with electron energy and reached a maximum value of 3 at 200 eV. A semi-empirical formula proposed by Drawin described the measured cross-section within the experimental error limits when the two adjustable parameters took the values of 0.5 and 1.
